required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PrEP Among MSM and TG in Myanmar
clinical_study.official_title: Pre-exposure Prophylaxis of HIV Infection Among Men Who Have Sex With Men (MSM) and Transgender Women (TG) in Suburban Yangon, Myanmar

brief_summary.textblock: HIV is concentrated among key populations in Myanmar. Globally, HIV-prevalence among transgender (TG) women is one of the highest; laboratory-confirmed prevalence is reported up to 40%. In September 2015, WHO recommended the use of Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) for people at substantial risk of HIV as part of a combination HIV prevention strategy. A demonstration project will take place to implement and evaluate the uptake and effectiveness of PrEP among MSM, and TG women in a clinic in Hlaingtharyar township, Yangon. The aim is to describe PrEP uptake, as well as HIV-seroconversion and STI infection rates among those who use PrEP.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of HIV-negative MSM and TG women who are taking PrEP among those who are eligible to take PrEP.

primary_outcome.measure: HIV seroconversion rate among PrEP user
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The portion of PrEP taking HIV negative MSM and TG women who become HIV positive while he is taking PrEP among those who are taking PrEP.

primary_outcome.measure: STI infection rates among PrEP user(Syphilis test, Gram stain for gonorrhoea and Xpert CT/NG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The number of positive episodes for either syphilis or gonorrhea or chlamydia infection among the PrEP taking MSM and Transgender women per number of testing among them.

arm_group.description: Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) will be offered to HIV negative MSM, TG identified to be at substantial risk for HIV infection and those motivated to take daily PrEP.

intervention.description: PrEP regimens of Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate (TDF) 300 mg/Lamivudine (3TC) 300mg per oral (PO) daily

study_pop.textblock: Individuals self-identified as belonging to the MSM and/or TG population who are eligible in line with selection criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-negative
- No suspicion of acute HIV infection
- Substantial risk of HIV infection
- Creatinine clearance is more than 30 ml/min
- Willingness to use PrEP as prescribed, including periodic HIV testing
- Willingness to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Anyone who is not eligible with the inclusion criteria
